item.title: Genshin Impact Gives Free Primogems With New Event and Code
item.description:
Genshin Impact has launched its pre-registration event for Version 6.0, coupled with a new redemption code, allowing players to obtain 160 Primogems for free ahead of Nod-Krai. In the wake of its livestream for Version 6.0, Genshin Impact has drummed up excitement with a set of surprising announcements: raising the level cap to 100, giving players a way to obtain Constellations for free, and revealing the Miliastra Wonderland.

In terms of its gacha, Version 6.0 has three key highlights: the stacked Event Banners, the Sumeru Chronicled Banner, and the Anniversary Selector. Much like in Natlan, players will be able to select one 5-Star from the Standard Banner to commemorate the fifth anniversary of Genshin Impact . This will also include Yumemizuki Mizuki, the 5-Star Anemo Catalyst introduced in Version 5.4. As for the Event Banners, the Nod-Krai era will kick off with Lauma and Nahida in the first half, while the second half of Version 6.0 will feature Flins and Yelan.

Genshin Impact: Redemption Codes for Version 6.0

  • R4SCAU7CR1G9 – 60 Primogems
  • LunaI0910 – 100 Primogems
  • LaumaNodKraiFlins – 100 Primogems
  • HiFiveTraveler – 100 Primogems
  • Bonus: Pre-Registration Reward

As part of its marketing campaign for Nod-Krai, Genshin Impact players can pre-register for Version 6.0 to receive 40 Primogems now, and 60 Primogems on September 10, 2025. Additionally, they can redeem a new promotional code for 60 Primogems, for a total of 160 Primogems. Those who haven't used the three codes from the Special Program Announcement can also redeem them by September 1, 2025. Thankfully, Genshin Impact will be generous with Primogems in Version 6.0, as many calculations estimate that free-to-play accounts will be able to earn 120 Intertwined Wishes.

While most aspects of Version 6.0 were positively received by the community, some Genshin Impact fans worry about the new level cap, as well as its immediate implications. Genshin Impact characters who scale with hit points or who focus on transformative reactions stand to benefit the most, such as Neuvilette, Alhaitham, Furina, and Nahida. In order to reach Level 100 on a single character, players must obtain three Masterless Stella Fortunas – a consumable awarded for every 5-Star obtained after reaching their C6.

As such, players should temper their expectations of the new level cap, and only consider it as an optional way to increase character power. Version 6.0 will also grant 1600 Primogems via mail, as well as 10 Intertwined Wishes through a login event. While this should help fans stock up on Primogems for their favorite characters, Nod-Krai in Genshin Impact is expected to have a stacked cast in its first half: Nefer, Durin, Columbina, and Varka are all rumored to debut before Version 6.5. The new region opens its doors to the Traveler and Paimon on September 10, 2025.

item.title: NBA 2K26: Best Teams for Point Guards in MyCareer
item.description:
In NBA 2K26 MyCareer, the draft can be random and based on how well MP performs in Europe. However, by selecting teams to work out with in the lead-up to the draft, or by selecting certain dialogue options, players can choose which team they play for in some cases, or have a much better shot at being drafted by them.

For those jumping into MyCareer as a Point Guard, it's best to look for teams that don't already have star Point Guards. This will give MP a better chance of starting for the team. It can also be good to look for teams with old Point Guards who might retire soon. When finding the best teams for Point Guards in NBA 2K26's MyCareer , it's also good to look for good link-up players , such as bigs for pick-and-rolls, or sharpshooters to pick out in the corner.

Brooklyn Nets

No Good True Point Guards

The Brooklyn Nets have the lowest-rated Point Guards in the league, although one of the Shooting Guards will likely start in the position. Nevertheless, there is ample opportunity for an out-and-out to run the show in Brooklyn and become a shining light for the team that lacks a true star.

New Orleans Pelicans

No Star Point Guard & Try To Help Zion Live Up To His Potential

The New Orleans Pelicans have depth in the Point Guard position, but no stars to speak of in the backcourt, meaning players have a clear path to the starting lineup. Perhaps they can finally help Zion Williamson live up to his potential and guide the Pelicans to some semblance of success.

Toronto Raptors

The Toronto Raptors have a young team full of talent, but potentially need a star Point Guard to take them back to the highs of 2019. Players will have to compete with Immanuel Quickley for starting minutes, but at 81-rated, this can be achieved. Scottie Barnes will be an exciting forward to link up with.

  • Link up players: Durant, Thompson, Sengun

While players may struggle to crack into the Houston Rockets' starting lineup, Fred VanVleet isn't a star player, nor is he getting any younger. More importantly, players have the opportunity to play alongside Kevin Durant, and with the Rockets doing well in the regular season last year, he could help them become title contenders. Amen Thompson is another rising star to link up with.

The Timberwolves have a strong team and have made it to the last two Western Conference finals, but Point Guard is their weakest position. Players can easily make the starting lineup with enough VC invested and play alongside Anthony Edwards in the backcourt. There would certainly be lots of potential for flashy passes between the two.

The Washington Wizards don't exactly have the strongest of squads, and while their Point Guard, C.J. McCollum, is arguably their best player, he is also 33. This allows MyCareer Point Guards to go in and become the star of this team. Hopefully, they can develop a partnership with bigman, Alex Sarr, the 2nd pick in the 2024 draft.

The Sacramento Kings have Dennis Schroder and Keon Ellis as potential starting Point Guards, but after De'Aaron Fox left for San Antonio, they lack a star in the position. With a fairly strong and experienced team, including Damontas Sabonis, Zach LeVine, and DeMar DeRozan, MP as a Point Guard could help the team secure playoffs in the 2025/2026 season, and possibly compete in the stacked Western Conference of the NBA.

In NBA 2K26 , the Milwaukee Bucks no longer have a Point Guard rated above 80 after the departure of Damien Lillard. As players will get to pair up with All-Star Giannis Antetokounmpo, this makes the Bucks one of the best teams to play Point Guard for in MyCareer. With the Greek Freak flying in, there is plenty of potential for alley-oops in NBA 2K26 ​​​​​.

item.title: PS Plus is Adding One of the Best Games Ever Made on September 2
item.description:
On Tuesday, September 2, PlayStation Plus subscribers can look forward to playing one of the best games of all time in Stardew Valley . The monthly free PlayStation Plus games vary wildly in quality, but there are times when subscribers are treated to some truly spectacular experiences.

At the time of this writing, subscribers still have time to claim the free PS Plus games for August 2025, which consist of Lies of P , DayZ , and My Hero One's Justice 2 . Many PS Plus subscribers were happy to get Lies of P for free, as the challenging Soulslike is often considered one of the best in its genre. Lies of P also recently received a critically-acclaimed expansion, so PS Plus subscribers that have enjoyed the game can check out even more content.

Stardew Valley Will Be Free on PS Plus in September

September 1 will be the last day that PS Plus subscribers can claim Lies of P and the other free games for August 2025, but more freebies are right around the corner. The free PS Plus games for September 2025 will be available on Tuesday, September 2, and include Psychonauts 2 , Stardew Valley , and Viewfinder . The September 2025 PS Plus lineup is one of the strongest of the year so far, with Stardew Valley standing out as one of the best games ever made. The farming/life sim Stardew Valley has enjoyed widespread critical acclaim since it was first released in 2016 and remains incredibly popular to this day. Substantial free updates have kept Stardew Valley fans engaged with the game and have propelled it to become one of the most successful indie games of all time. PS Plus subscribers that have yet to play Stardew Valley for themselves should mark their calendars accordingly, as they will be able to get it completely free of charge on September 2.

That's not to say that the other free PS Plus games for September 2025 are slouches. On the contrary, Psychonauts 2 is an incredible 3D platformer that has also earned critical acclaim. Viewfinder is a great puzzle game as well that should appeal to fans of games like Portal , so all things considered, the free PS Plus games for September 2025 have a lot to offer.

The downside is that, considering Stardew Valley 's dizzying popularity, there's a good chance that many PS Plus subscribers already have the game in their digital libraries. If so, they will understandably not be as excited about the free PS Plus games for the September 2025 lineup, but for those that have yet to check out Stardew Valley , September's offerings should be some of the best the year has to offer. As a reminder, the free PlayStation Plus games are available to subscribers across the Essential, Extra, and Premium tiers, so all PS Plus subscribers will be able to claim Stardew Valley , Psychonauts 2 , and Viewfinder come Tuesday, September 2.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases Version 3.7 and 3.8 Characters
item.description:
New Honkai: Star Rail leaks are hinting at a pair of new characters coming to the game in a future update, including one previously teased roster member. The sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse has brought a plethora of exciting character releases to the game throughout its most recent updates, between crossovers and new variants of older characters. Version 3.4 introduced the long-awaited Fate/Stay Night collaboration, adding both Saber and Archer as playable characters, while Version 3.6 will add new versions of Dan Heng and March 7th. Now, even more upcoming Honkai: Star Rail characters are being teased.

Star Rail 's newest world of Amphoreus has seen no shortage of massive, game-changing characters join the game's roster. Castorice's debut in Version 3.2 quickly became one of the most influential launches yet within the game, instantly becoming a top-tier character with her powerful global passive ability. The recent release of Hysilens also saw major success following her release, debuting as a powerful DoT-focused DPS character within Honkai: Star Rail . A new leak is now giving clues about two new members of Star Rail 's roster.

Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases Cyrene, Constance

New information shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Sakura Haven is hinting at two new Star Rail characters in Versions 3.7 and 3.8. According to the leak, both Cyrene and a new Penacony-aligned character are set to appear throughout Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 3.7 and Version 3.8 updates, likely debuting in that same order. The post suggests that the Penacony character will be a Nihility unit within Honkai: Star Rail , while also hinting that the character is likely the previously teased Constance. No other characters were confirmed for the update, though information for Screwllum was found within the data.

The pair of new characters coming to Honkai: Star Rail during its next updates come as one has already appeared prominently within the main story. Cyrene first appeared as an NPC in the Version 3.0 update, introduced within Amphoreus as the world's Chrysos Heir of Time. Constance has also been teased in HoYoverse's official promotional material for Honkai: Star Rail , hinting at her as a member of Penacony's Ever-Flame Mansion. Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 3.7 update is expected to launch in early November, while Version 3.8 will likely release sometime in December.

While information has begun to surface about future Star Rail characters, fans won't have to wait long for the game's next big update. Version 3.6 is set to launch on September 24 and will bring with it the release of both Evernight and Permansor Terrae as new five-star variants of March 7th and Dan Heng. Leaks have also hinted at some Amphoreus characters that may receive re-runs during the update, particularly hinting at Castorice and Anaxa. Honkai: Star Rail fans should have lots to look forward to from the game's upcoming updates.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Addresses Server Queue Concerns
item.description:
Battlefield 6 has addressed concerns about server queues at launch. With Battlefield 6 looking set to become a huge hit upon its October 10 launch, every precaution is being taken to make sure players can get into games easily.

The massive success of Battlefield 6 's open beta has led to hype for the upcoming first-person shooter going through the roof. While players had their share of feedback, the overriding sentiment towards the game was positive, so it will be interesting to see if that translates to actual sales. However, should Battlefield 6 prove to be a financial smash, it's crucial that Battlefield Studios has the framework in place to make the experience as smooth as possible for players.

Battlefield 6 is Aiming to Avoid Server Queues at Launch

Speaking to Comic Book, Studio Technical Director Christian Buhl claimed that lessons have been learned from the recent Battlefield 6 open beta that should allow for more stability at launch. "We’ve made many adjustments to our projections thanks to the success of our open beta. All of the stuff I said about stability and performance also applies to server stability and server performance, so we’ve been putting a lot of effort into that as well. I mean a little bit of behind the scenes, we run a test where we basically simulate whatever our target is, whether it’s a million or four million. We set a target for the number of players we want to have connected to our systems at a time or at launch and we run a simulation with simulated players."

Naturally, these tests haven't always gone to plan. According to Buhl, "The first time we run it, it doesn’t work, right? Some system falls over, something breaks. Great, but it broke then, right? It broke during our testing and then we fix it. We add machines, we optimize that system and we keep repeating that until we hit the numbers that we feel confident that we think we need to hit for launch. So, that’s the approach we’ve been taking to that."

On the possibility of server queues, they exist, but Buhl hopes the Battlefield 6 launch won't necessitate using them. "We’re always going to have that as a tool, but we are planning on not needing it for launch. We have projections and then we’re preparing for more than our projections to make sure that as much as possible, we don’t have to have server queues for launch... We have a cap, but we’re setting the cap much higher than we are hoping we hit."

The Battlefield 6 team has been speaking quite openly about what fans can expect from the upcoming shooter. Just recently, another Battlefield 6 developer admitted that the game's highly-criticized menus might still be clunky at launch, so it seems not all feedback from the open beta will be fully addressed in time for October 10.
